etymology.description: Two 十 (“ten”) written side by side, with a horizontal stroke at the bottom that fuses them; see also 卅. In characters such as 漢 and 黄, it represents 口, while in 度 and 席 it represents a stylized 石.
etymology.interpretation: Two tens placed together communicate the value twenty, with the bottom stroke uniting them into a single form. As a component, the shape can be borrowed to stand for a mouth (口) or a rock (石) depending on historical usage in different characters.

examples.chinese: 今天是农历廿一日(今天是農曆廿一日)。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān shì nónglì niàn yī rì.
examples.english: Today is the twenty-first day of the lunar month.

examples.chinese: 他已经在此居住廿年(他已經在此居住廿年)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǐjīng zài cǐ jūzhù niàn nián.
examples.english: He has lived here for twenty years.

examples.chinese: 会议将在本月廿五日举行(會議將在本月廿五日舉行)。
examples.pinyin: Huìyì jiāng zài běn yuè niàn wǔ rì jǔxíng.
examples.english: The meeting will be held on the twenty-fifth of this month.
